step1.sentence: My laptop started acting up right before the big presentation, freezing every few minutes.

step2.story: The car began acting up on the highway, making a loud rattling noise and losing speed. Mia pulled over and called for help, frustrated that this had happened on such an important day.

step3.story: Jake had barely sat down at his desk when his computer started acting up again. The screen flickered, the mouse lagged, and half his files refused to open. He had a report due in two hours and now this. He called IT support, but they said they couldn't come until the afternoon. Taking a deep breath, he borrowed a colleague's laptop and began transferring his files, determined not to let a malfunctioning machine ruin his day.

meaning.realUsageKo: 사람이나 기계, 신체 등이 예상대로 작동하지 않거나 말썽을 부릴 때 사용한다. 예를 들어 아이가 말을 안 듣거나 기기가 오작동할 때 자주 쓴다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'act'(행동하다)와 'up'(강조 부사)이 결합한 구동사로, 18~19세기부터 '비정상적으로 행동하다'는 의미로 영어권에서 사용되어 왔다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 가벼운 불평이나 불만을 담은 구어적 표현으로, 격식 없는 일상 대화에서 주로 쓰인다. 심각한 고장보다는 일시적인 말썽이나 이상 동작에 어울린다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: My knee has been acting up since the soccer game.
